TopicTitle: What the.. WHAAAT? I don`t even...what?

Articles.Content:
So today I was messing with the RSS, when I discovered, that something awful has happened in Cape Canaveral

HOW? WHY? WHAT?

HOW AM I SUPPOST TO LAND PLANES?!

OR START GRAVITY TURNS?!

(To the forum staff: This thread isnÃ‚Â´t made to seek support! It is just to show the hilarity of this problem )

Edited May 2, 2014 by BadRocketsCo.
It's a Kerbinhole! How deep is it?
ATLEAST 4-5km I think, I am kinda afk right now
Also, by what I remember, the ground seemed to be on the same level with the ocean...thank god we don't have flowing water in KSP yet

Ha!

(This is filler)
That is where the Kraken sat down for a breather.
Possible real-time damage from an asteroid collision? That'd be cool.
Yeah, actually, the KSC isn't in a hole, but everything around KSC seems to be a mountain. A 16700 meter long mountain, to be more exact

That thing is twice the height of Mount Everest!

I respect the comedy value of this, but usually space centers are better, when they aren't in a valley

Edited May 2, 2014 by BadRocketsCo.
lol that is so cool, you should put the save game up on spaceport (assuming it's not a transient bug) I for one could have a lot of fun making rock crawlers, VTOL's and such for that pit
The pug has happened because something has happened with the RSS mod, so I don't think, I could share it.
Brought home some Mohole bacteria?

Brought home some Mohole bacteria?

Seems so
Seems your Delta-V gravity well just got a smidge deeper ...

Oh, Jesus khrist, yeah

Edited May 2, 2014 by BadRocketsCo.
Kerbin is getting infected by Moho. Period.

hahah something similar happened to me once, i tried to replace kerbin with earth, i think its a cfg for rss, anyway my ksc was in a hole like that, physics were normal at the bottom but once you got closer to the top things started to get weird, after "passing" the hole the atmosphere dissapeared but i wasn't in space, all was black but i could only see the mun and the ground were the ksc was, only the things at the bottom of the hole, everything else was black.

hahah something similar happened to me once, i tried to replace kerbin with earth, i think its a cfg for rss, anyway my ksc was in a hole like that, physics were normal at the bottom but once you got closer to the top things started to get weird, after "passing" the hole the atmosphere dissapeared but i wasn't in space, all was black but i could only see the mun and the ground were the ksc was, only the things at the bottom of the hole, everything else was black.

Huh, ok. How did you fix it?

When I get above the hole, the physics, ground under me and atmosphere remain, but all the ground above the hole is made out of sand or rock

Edited May 2, 2014 by BadRocketsCo.
Anyways, I guess, that this is, what happens, when Earth really starts to love Moho. Does anyone know, how deep the Mohole is?
One of the rocket scientists must have divided by zero.

Anyways, I guess, that this is, what happens, when Earth really starts to love Moho. Does anyone know, how deep the Mohole is?

If I remember right, it's something like 4-6 km deep...
That's what happens when you build the biggest lifter ever, and accidentally point it in the wrong direction.
This has caused many an inappropriate joke about reproduction at the Space Bar in my astronaut center.
These comments are starting to get more hilarious, than the big hole in the side of simulated Florida.
Please, someone, write a long backstory to this .
